adverbs.description: dashingly (comparative more dashingly, superlative most dashingly)

examples: […]  Sir Benjamin was compelled to put her into the possession of the solid sum of twenty thousand pounds; with one part of which her debts were paid to liberate Block from prison, and with the remainder he dashingly resolved to cut his employers, who had refused his drafts, and set up in trade for himself  […]

entries.meaning: In a boldly chic, fashionable manner.
examples: The sedan chairs, in which the ladies go to church, and pay visits to their friends, had now put on a much smarter appearance, and the men who carried them were dressed more dashingly.
